Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that has plenty of water and is healthy and growing.
The student can draw a plant that does not have water and is wilting or dying.
The student can show in the drawings that plants need water to live and grow.
The student can illustrate the differences between a plant that is getting enough water and one that is not.
The student can include observations from real-life or media about how plants change with or without water.
The student can demonstrate understanding that patterns in how plants respond to water can be observed and used as evidence.
